comment: The second supplement to the law of quadratic reciprocity (for the Legendre symbol extended to arbitrary primes as second argument). Two is a square modulo a prime ` P ` iff ` P == +- 1 ` (mod ` 8 ` ), see first case of theorem 9.5 in [ApostolNT] p. 181. This theorem justifies our definition of ` ( N /L 2 ) ` ( ~ lgs2 ) to some degree, by demanding that reciprocity extend to the case ` Q = 2 ` . (Proposed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.) (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2021.)
